div.p:
Each week, Cimarron Elementary-Middle School and Cimarron High School would like to send Shout-Outs to staff and students who have gone above and beyond or are just doing really cool things. These shout-outs can be submitted by staff, students, parents, or community members by emailing them to jmartinez@cimarronschools.org.
We will add the Shout-Outs for the week via links found below:
Shout Outs for April 6-April 24

April 22, 2020
New Mexico State Agencies Launch Free, Virtual Talks for Parents and Educators Experts on Parenting, Child Development, and Behavioral Health Will Offer Presentations, Answer Questions from New Mexicans
Santa Fe - Today, the Early Childhood Education and Care Department (ECECD) and the Children, Youth and Families Department (CYFD) announced a series of Zoom-based presentations to support parents, families, and educators during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The first . . .

h3.a: Cimarron High School Senior, Ryan Smith, named a Daniels Scholar!

div.p:
Congratulations Ryan Smith on being selected as a Daniels Scholar!
Recipients of the Daniels Scholarship were recently announced. Out of a pool of over 2000 applicants, only 212 were chosen from Colorado, New Mexico, Utah, and Wyoming. From New Mexico, there were only 24, and our very own Ryan Smith is one of those 24. You can read more in the article below from the Albuquerque Journal. We are very proud of Ryan!
24 Daniels Scholars Selected from NM (Article from Albuquerque Journal)

a.aria-label: Read more about Cimarron High School Senior, Ryan Smith, named a Daniels Scholar!

div.p:
The health, safety, and well-being of our students, staff, and families is our number one priority.
On Monday March 23, 2020, Governor Michelle Lujan Grisham announced additional restrictions to disrupt the spread of the COVID-19 virus in New Mexico and instructed New Mexicans to remain in their homes or places of residence except for outings necessary for health, safety and welfare.
In light of these new restrictions, the Cimarron Municipal School District is taking extra precautions with necessary meetings. All Board of Education meetings will be virtual meetings for the foreseeable future, until . . .

div.p:
April 3, 2020
Dear Students, Parents, and Guardians,
Today, Cimarron Municipal Schools is releasing its Continuous Learning Plan. It is included in this email and is also posted on our district website at www.cimarronschools.org . This plan is extensive and will cover most components. Please read through the plan, as it will provide guidance on what our continuous learning will look like, time guidelines, expectations, etc. This plan will be implemented, starting on Tuesday, April 7 and continuing through the remainder of the regular school year (to May . . .

div.p:
Cimarron Municipal Schools has these positions available:
Principal - Eagle Nest Elem/Mid
School Nurse-District
Bus Driver*
Bus Driver Substitute*
Substitute Teacher
*We can provide training if you are not a certified bus driver.
If you are interested, please visit our website:
www.cimarronschools.org
Employment Opportunities
If you have questions, please contact Amber Archuleta at 575-376-2445 ext. 102

div.p:
UPDATED Food Service Plan for Students:
Students can pick up a Grab and Go Lunch and Breakfast for the following day at the following locations/times, Monday through Friday for the duration of the closure:
Cimarron Elementary Cafeteria (West side of building): 11:00 am - 1:00 pm daily
Eagle Nest School (front of the building): 11:30 am - 12:30 pm daily
Angel Nest Apartments (front of the building): 11:45 am - 12:00 pm daily
*Val Verde Trailer Park (front of park) 12:00 pm - 12:15 pm daily
Angel Skye Apartments (front of the building): 12:15 pm - 12:30 pm daily
Lowe's grocery . . .

font.marquee: Vision: To inspire our students to realize their individual potential in an ever-changing world. Mission: Cimarron Municipal Schools will work hand-in-hand with our families and community to provide our students the experience of a safe and challenging educational environment through staff who know and nurture every child. Standardization!" Houston
